course.description_en: Learn about the special things we do every day from morning to night. Discover how routines help us stay healthy, happy, and organized.
course.description_ar: تعلم عن الأشياء المميزة التي نفعلها كل يوم من الصباح إلى الليل. اكتشف كيف تساعدنا الروتينات على البقاء بصحة جيدة وسعداء ومنظمين.
course.subject: social_studies

content_data.title: Wake Up, Sunshine! Starting Our Day
content_data.content: Good morning! The sun is up. Time to wake up! First, we stretch our arms high. Stretch, stretch, stretch! Then we get out of bed. We put our feet on the floor. Next, we brush our teeth. Brush, brush, brush! After that, we wash our face. Splash with water! Then we get dressed. Put on shirt. Put on pants. Last, we eat breakfast. Yummy food gives us energy! Morning time makes us ready for the day. What a great start!
learning_objectives: Learn the steps of a morning routine
Understand the importance of starting the day well
Practice sequencing daily activities

vocabulary_words.definition: Early time of day when the sun comes up
Stop sleeping and open your eyes
Make your arms and body long and wide
Clean your teeth with a toothbrush
First meal we eat in the morning
Power that helps your body move and play

content_data.parent_guidance: Go through each morning step with child. Let them practice brushing teeth with dry toothbrush. Help with getting dressed. Make stretching fun and gentle. Use actual morning routine items when possible. Connect lesson to their real morning routine.
safety_notes: Supervise toothbrush use - no toothpaste for demonstration
Ensure clothes are appropriate size for practice
Use unbreakable mirror if available
Keep stretching gentle to prevent injury
Use only safe pretend food items
discussion_questions: What do we do first when we wake up?
Why do we brush our teeth?
What gives us energy in the morning?

extension_activities.title: Morning Routine Practice
extension_activities.description: Act out the whole morning routine step by step with child.

extension_activities.title: Morning Checklist
extension_activities.description: Make a simple picture checklist of morning activities.

content_data.title: Three Special Meals Every Day
content_data.content: We eat three meals every day! First is breakfast in the morning. Breakfast gives us energy to play. Next is lunch in the middle of the day. Lunch keeps us strong. Last is dinner at night with family. Dinner brings us together. Before we eat, we wash our hands. Clean hands keep us healthy! We sit at the table nicely. We use our fork and spoon. We say 'please' and 'thank you.' After eating, we clean up together. Meal time is special family time!
learning_objectives: Identify the three main meals of the day
Learn proper meal time manners and hygiene
Understand meal times as family bonding time

vocabulary_words.definition: Morning meal that starts our day
Middle-of-the-day meal
Evening meal eaten with family
Good for your body and keeps you strong
Polite ways to behave, especially when eating
People who live together and love each other

content_data.parent_guidance: Set up pretend meal time with child. Practice proper hand washing before eating. Show how to use fork and spoon correctly. Emphasize 'please' and 'thank you.' Make it fun by having pretend family meal together. Connect to your family's actual meal routines.
safety_notes: Use only safe, large play food items
Ensure play utensils have no sharp edges
Supervise all pretend eating activities
Keep play dishes unbreakable
Demonstrate proper hand washing with soap and water
discussion_questions: What are the three meals we eat?
What do we do before we eat?
How do we use good manners at meal time?

extension_activities.title: Pretend Restaurant
extension_activities.description: Set up pretend restaurant where child practices ordering and eating politely.

extension_activities.title: Meal Planning Game
extension_activities.description: Look at pictures of foods and sort them into breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

content_data.title: Fun Times During Our Day
content_data.content: Every day has special times for different activities! Play time is when we have fun. We play with toys. We run and laugh. We use our imagination. Learn time is when we discover new things. We read books. We sing songs. We practice counting. Sometimes we play outside. Fresh air feels good! Sometimes we play inside. We stay safe and warm. We take turns with toys. We share with friends. We clean up when done. Play time and learn time help us grow big and smart!
learning_objectives: Distinguish between play time and learning time
Understand the importance of both play and learning
Practice sharing and taking turns

vocabulary_words.definition: Special time for having fun with toys and games
Special time for discovering and practicing new things
Using your mind to pretend and create stories
Clean air from outside that feels good to breathe
Let others use your toys too
Everyone gets a chance to play with something

content_data.parent_guidance: Show difference between play activities and learning activities. Practice taking turns with toys. Demonstrate sharing behaviors. Let child choose between play and learning activities. Emphasize that both are important and fun. Help child clean up after activities.
safety_notes: Use only age-appropriate, safe toys
Ensure all toys are large enough to prevent choking
Supervise outdoor play references
Keep all activities at child's developmental level
Monitor sharing activities to prevent conflicts
discussion_questions: What do we do during play time?
What do we do during learn time?
How do we share toys with others?

extension_activities.title: Activity Sorting Game
extension_activities.description: Sort pictures of activities into 'play time' and 'learn time' categories.
materials: Two boxes or areas for sorting

extension_activities.title: Turn-Taking Practice
extension_activities.description: Practice taking turns with a special toy using a timer.

content_data.title: Helping Hands Make Everything Clean
content_data.content: After we play, it's time to clean up! Toys need to go back home. Books go on the shelf. Blocks go in the box. Cars go in the garage. We are helpers! We pick up toys one by one. We put them in the right place. Clean up makes our home nice. Clean up keeps things safe. When everything is tidy, we feel happy. Cleaning up is fast when we all help. We sing the clean-up song! 'Clean up, clean up, everybody everywhere!' Good helpers make the best homes!
learning_objectives: Learn the importance of cleaning up after activities
Practice putting things in their proper places
Develop responsibility and helping skills

vocabulary_words.definition: Put toys and things back where they belong
Neat and organized, everything in its place
People who do good things to help others
Flat place on the wall where we put books
Special place where cars and trucks live
Job you do to help your family

materials_needed: Various toys to practice cleaning up
Boxes or containers for toy storage
content_data.parent_guidance: Make cleaning up fun, not a chore. Sing the clean-up song together. Show child where each type of toy belongs. Help child put things away correctly. Praise efforts, not just results. Start with just a few items to avoid overwhelming child.
safety_notes: Ensure storage containers are safe and stable
Help child reach appropriate heights safely
Don't overload child with too many items at once
Make sure shelves and storage areas are child-safe
Supervise to prevent injuries while cleaning
discussion_questions: Where do the toys go when we're done playing?
Why is it important to clean up?
How can we be good helpers?

extension_activities.title: Toy Home Matching
extension_activities.description: Match different toys to their correct 'homes' or storage places.

extension_activities.title: Clean-Up Race
extension_activities.description: See how quickly child can put toys away (make it fun, not stressful).

content_data.title: Splash, Splash! Time to Get Clean
content_data.content: Bath time is fun and important! We take baths to get clean. First, we fill the tub with warm water. Warm water feels nice. We add some bubbles. Bubbles are fun to pop! We wash our hair with shampoo. We wash our body with soap. We scrub our hands and feet. We rinse with clean water. After bath, we dry off with a soft towel. We put on clean pajamas. Bath time makes us fresh and clean. Clean bodies feel good and healthy!
learning_objectives: Understand the importance of personal hygiene
Learn the steps of taking a bath
Practice bath time vocabulary and actions

vocabulary_words.definition: Washing your whole body in water
Not dirty, washed with soap and water
Little round soap balls that float in water
Special soap for washing hair
Wash away soap with clean water
Special clothes for sleeping

materials_needed: Doll or stuffed animal for bath demonstration
Small basin or bowl for pretend bath
content_data.parent_guidance: Use doll to demonstrate bath steps safely. Let child practice washing doll. Talk about each step as you do it. Make bath time sound fun, not scary. If child is afraid of baths, go slowly and keep demonstration positive. Connect to their real bath routine.
safety_notes: Never leave child alone during any water activities
Use only small amounts of water for demonstration
Keep demonstration area safe from slipping
Ensure all materials are clean and safe
No real bathing during lesson - demonstration only
discussion_questions: Why do we take baths?
What do we use to wash our hair?
How do we get dry after a bath?

extension_activities.title: Doll Bath Time
extension_activities.description: Give a baby doll a pretend bath, practicing all the steps learned.

extension_activities.title: Bath Time Story
extension_activities.description: Read books about bath time or create stories about getting clean.

content_data.title: Getting Ready for a Good Night's Sleep
content_data.content: When the sun goes down, it's time for bed. Bedtime helps our bodies rest. First, we put on our cozy pajamas. Next, we brush our teeth again. Clean teeth sleep better! Then we wash our face and hands. After that, we read a story together. Stories help us feel calm. We say goodnight to family. We hug our teddy bear. We pull up our warm blanket. We close our eyes. Sleep helps us grow. Sleep gives us energy for tomorrow. Sweet dreams until morning!
learning_objectives: Learn the steps of a bedtime routine
Understand why sleep is important for growing bodies
Practice calming bedtime activities

vocabulary_words.definition: Special time when we go to sleep
Soft clothes we wear to sleep
Warm and comfortable feeling
Peaceful and quiet, not excited
Soft cover that keeps us warm in bed
Pictures and stories in our mind while sleeping

content_data.parent_guidance: Keep this lesson calm and soothing. Practice bedtime routine gently. Let child hold comfort items during lesson. Read in soft voice. Connect to child's actual bedtime routine. Make bedtime sound peaceful and safe, not scary.
safety_notes: Keep lesson atmosphere calm and quiet
Ensure all bedtime items are safe
Use child's actual comfort items if possible
Make sure stuffed animals are clean
Keep lighting soft and comfortable
discussion_questions: What do we do to get ready for bed?
Why is sleep important for our bodies?
What helps you feel calm at bedtime?

extension_activities.title: Teddy Bear Bedtime
extension_activities.description: Put teddy bear to bed using all the bedtime routine steps.

extension_activities.title: Bedtime Story Creation
extension_activities.description: Make up a simple bedtime story about going to sleep.

content_data.title: What Do You Know About Our Daily Routines?
content_data.content: Let's play a fun game about our daily routines! I will ask you questions about the things we do every day. You can point to pictures, act it out, or tell me with words!
learning_objectives: Review all daily routine activities learned
Practice sequencing daily events
Show understanding of routine importance

vocabulary_words.definition: Fun game with questions about what you learned
Things we do the same way every day

materials_needed: Props from previous lessons for demonstration
content_data.parent_guidance: Ask questions gently and give child plenty of time to respond. Accept any form of answer - pointing, acting, or words. Use pictures to help child remember. Keep quiz fun and encouraging. Celebrate every response positively.
safety_notes: Keep quiz atmosphere positive and stress-free
No pressure for perfect answers
Take breaks if child seems tired
Use familiar, safe materials only
discussion_questions: What do we do first when we wake up in the morning?
Show me how we brush our teeth!
What are the three meals we eat every day?
Point to what we do during play time!
How do we clean up our toys?
What do we wear to take a bath?
Show me how we get ready for bed!
Which comes first - breakfast or dinner?
What helps our bodies rest and grow?

extension_activities.title: Routine Sequencing Game
extension_activities.description: Put pictures of daily activities in the correct order from morning to night.

extension_activities.title: Daily Routine Acting
extension_activities.description: Act out different parts of daily routine while others guess which activity it is.

content_data.title: Celebrating Our Wonderful Daily Routines
content_data.content: Let's celebrate all the special things we do every day! Our daily routines help us stay healthy and happy. From morning wake-up to nighttime sleep, every part of our day is important. Let's go through our whole day together! Morning: Wake up, stretch, brush teeth, get dressed, eat breakfast. Daytime: Play, learn, eat lunch, clean up. Evening: Eat dinner, take bath, brush teeth, bedtime story, sleep. Every routine helps us grow big and strong! We are such good routine followers! Let's sing our Daily Routine Song: 'Morning, noon, and night, we do things right!'
learning_objectives: Review and celebrate all daily routines learned
Understand the complete flow of a day
Build confidence in following routines independently

vocabulary_words.definition: Be very happy about something good
Special things we do the same way every day
Good for your body and makes you strong
Doing things by yourself like a big kid
How things go from one to the next smoothly
People who do the right things in the right order

materials_needed: All pictures and props from previous lessons
content_data.parent_guidance: Go through entire day's routine enthusiastically with child. Use all props and pictures from previous lessons. Take photos of child demonstrating different routines if desired. Make this feel like a real celebration of learning. Emphasize how grown-up child is becoming with good routines.
safety_notes: Keep celebration positive and encouraging
Use all previously verified safe materials
Keep music at appropriate volume
Take breaks if child becomes overstimulated
Ensure all activities remain age-appropriate
discussion_questions: What's your favorite part of the daily routine?
Which routine helps you stay healthy?
How do routines help our family?

extension_activities.title: Personal Routine Chart
extension_activities.description: Create a special chart showing child's own daily routine with pictures.

extension_activities.title: Routine Helper Badge
extension_activities.description: Make a special 'Routine Helper' badge for child to wear proudly.

extension_activities.title: Family Routine Show
extension_activities.description: Child teaches family members about daily routines like a teacher.
